Name: weatherflow2mqtt
Overview: This project monitors the UDP socket (50222) from a WeatherFlow Hub, and publishes the data to a MQTT Server. Data is formatted in a way that, it supports the MQTT Discovery format for Home Assistant, so a sensor will created for each entity that WeatherFlow sends out, if you have MQTT Discovery enabled.

Unit System.Name: Unit System
Unit System.Description: Enter imperial or metric. This will determine the unit system used when displaying the values. Default is metric

ELEVATION.Name: ELEVATION
ELEVATION.Description: Set the hight above sea level for where the station is placed. This is used when calculating some of the sensor values. Station elevation plus Device height above ground. The value has to be in meters (meters = feet * 0.3048). Default is 0

MQTT_HOST.Name: MQTT_HOST
MQTT_HOST.Description: The IP address of your mqtt server. Even though you have the MQTT Server on the same machine as this Container, don't use 127.0.0.1 as this will resolve to an IP Address inside your container. Use the external IP Address. Default value is 127.0.0.1 (Required)

MQTT_PORT.Name: MQTT_PORT
MQTT_PORT.Description: The Port for your mqtt server. Default value is 1883

STATION_ID.Name: STATION_ID
STATION_ID.Description: Enter your Station ID for your WeatherFlow Station. Default value is blank.

STATION_TOKEN.Name: STATION_TOKEN
STATION_TOKEN.Description: Enter your personal access Token to allow retrieval of data. If you don't have the token login with your account and create the token. NOTE You must own a WeatherFlow station to get this token. Default value is blank

FORECAST_INTERVAL.Name: FORECAST_INTERVAL
FORECAST_INTERVAL.Description: The interval in minutes, between updates of the Forecast data. Default value is 30 minutes.

MQTT_USERNAME.Name: MQTT_USERNAME
MQTT_USERNAME.Description: The username used to connect to the mqtt server. Leave blank to use Anonymous connection. Default value is blank

MQTT_PASSWORD.Name: MQTT_PASSWORD
MQTT_PASSWORD.Description: The password used to connect to the mqtt server. Leave blank to use Anonymous connection. Default value is blank

Language.Name: Language
Language.Description:
Use this to set the language for Wind Direction cardinals and other sensors with text strings as state value. These strings will then be displayed in HA in the selected language. 

Currently these languages are supported for Wind Cardinals and other Text state strings:

en: English
da: Danish
de: German
fr: French

RAPID_WIND_INTERVAL.Name: RAPID_WIND_INTERVAL
RAPID_WIND_INTERVAL.Description: The weather stations delivers wind speed and bearing every 2 seconds. If you don't want to update the HA sensors so often, you can set a number here (in seconds), for how often they are updated. Default is 0, which means data are updated when received from the station.

WF_HOST.Name: WF_HOST
WF_HOST.Description: Unless you have a very special IP setup or the Weatherflow hub is on a different network, you should not change this. Default is 0.0.0.0

WF_PORT.Name: WF_PORT
WF_PORT.Description: Weatherflow always broadcasts on port 50222/udp, so don't change this. Default is 50222

MQTT_DEBUG.Name: MQTT_DEBUG
MQTT_DEBUG.Description: Set this to True, to get some more mqtt debugging messages in the Container log file. Default value is False

DEBUG.Name: DEBUG
DEBUG.Description: Set this to True to enable more debug data in the Container Log. Default is False
